title: Retail Food Group launches equity raise; three brokers on deal
text:
Retail Food Group is in the market with a big recapitalisation equity raising, as foreshadowed by Street Talk.

The franchisor is seeking to raise $150 million via a placement and another $10 million in a share purchase plan.

Retail Food Group has hired Petra Capital and Shaw and Partners to oversee a $160 million raising; Aitken Murray Capital Partners is on board as a co-lead manager. Jessica Shapiro JLS

Petra Capital, Shaw and Partners and Aitken Murray Capital Partners are overseeing the deal.

Funds raised would be used to repay $120 million debt and RFG's lenders have agreed to write down $72 million of the senior debt as part of a $75 million refinancing.

New shares were for sale at 10¢ each which was a 41.2 per cent discount to the last close and a a 42 per cent discount to the five-day volume weighted average price.
description: Retail Food Group is in the market with a big recapitalisation equity raising.
